workflow.name: GitHub bounty issue tracker & alert system (Google Sheets + Email/WhatsApp)
workflow.description:
# GitHub Bounty Issue Tracker & Alert System (Google Sheets + Email/WhatsApp)

## Overview
Looking for a way to **track GitHub bounty issues automatically** and get notified in real time? This **GitHub Bounty Tracker workflow** monitors repositories for issues labeled üíé *Bounty*, logs them in Google Sheets, and sends instant alerts via Email (HTML-styled) or WhatsApp. Perfect for **developers, freelancers, and open-source contributors** who want to discover and claim paid opportunities faster.  

---

## What This Workflow Does

### üîé Automated Bounty Discovery
- Searches GitHub hourly for all open issues labeled with ‚Äúüíé Bounty.‚Äù  
- Filters duplicates to avoid re-tracking the same issue.  

### üì¢ Smart Notifications
- Sends styled HTML email alerts with GitHub-themed design.  
- WhatsApp Business API integration (optional, disabled by default).  
- Alerts only for bounties created within the last 5 days.  

### üìä Google Sheets Tracking
- **Sheet1**: Complete bounty list (all tracked issues).  
- **Sheet2**: Recent notification log (for quick reference).  

### üîÑ Status Updates
- Checks every 6 hours for issue changes (open/closed state, new comments).  
- Includes bounty amount, issue details, and direct GitHub links.  

---

## Use Cases

- üë©‚Äçüíª **Freelance developers** hunting for paid open-source work.  
- üõ† **Development teams** tracking bounty opportunities for their stack.  
- üåç **Community managers** monitoring open-source bounty program engagement.  
- ü§ù **Open-source contributors** looking for compensated tasks.  

---

## Requirements

- GitHub Personal Access Token (with repo access).  
- Google Sheets (2 sheets required: Sheet1 = bounties, Sheet2 = notifications).  
- Gmail account (OAuth2 for sending email alerts).  
- WhatsApp Business API credentials (optional).  

---

## Configuration Notes
This workflow supports pagination for large result sets and includes filters to prevent duplicate notifications.  
You can **customize the GitHub search query** in the HTTP Request node to target:  
- Specific repositories  
- Custom labels  
- Team/organization projects  

---

## Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

**Q: How often will I get notifications?**  
A: By default, new bounties trigger alerts once an hour. Updates on existing issues (status/comments) are checked every 6 hours.  

**Q: Do I need WhatsApp integration?**  
A: No, it‚Äôs optional. Email alerts work out-of-the-box.  

**Q: Can I filter by bounty amount?**  
A: Yes, the workflow extracts bounty details and you can add filters in your Google Sheets or notification logic.  

---

## Why Use This GitHub Bounty Tracker?
Unlike manual searches, this workflow ensures you **never miss a paid GitHub issue**. Whether you‚Äôre a **freelancer looking for income, a team seeking funded tasks, or a contributor wanting recognition and rewards**, this system keeps you updated automatically.

nodes.name: Split Out
nodes.notes: This splits out results of the 'GitHub Search HTTP Request' node into individual items so operation can be performed on each item, instead of having a list of all items

nodes.name: Merge
nodes.notes: Merge all data from 'GitHub Search HTTP Request' node with 'Get row(s) in sheet' node results in order to filter out recent ones not found in the Google Spreadsheet doc

nodes.name: Filter
nodes.notes: Filter out data not found in the Google Spreadsheet but is found in GitHub Search HTTP Request node results

nodes.name: Append row in sheet
nodes.notes: Add data not found in 'Get row(s) in sheet' node but found in 'GitHub Search HTTP Request' node result

parameters.html:
New GitHub Bounty Issue Alert!

Issue: {{ $('Filter').item.json.title }}

Number: #{{ $('Filter').item.json.number }}
Status: {{ $('Filter').item.json.state }}
Bounty Amount:{{ $('Filter').item.json.labels.find(label => label.name.includes('$'))?.name || 'No bounty specified' }}
Comments on Issue: {{ $('Filter').item.json.comments }}
Bounty Issue Created on: {{ $('Filter').item.json.created_at }}
Repository: {{ $('Filter').item.json.repository_url.split('/').pop() }}
View Issue on GitHub

conditions.leftValue: ={{ $('Get row(s) in sheet1').item.json['Number of Issue Comments'] }}

parameters.content:
## Fetch & Split Bounties
- Fetches all open GitHub issues with bounty label
- Pagination enabled (100 per page)
- Split Out converts array into individual items

## Main Workflow Trigger
Runs every hour to check for new GitHub bounty issues with the 'üíé Bounty' label

## Compare with Existing Data
Merges GitHub results with Sheet1 to identify which bounties are already tracked

## Filter New Bounties Only
Keeps only issues where title is NOT found in Sheet1's "Issue Name" column

## Filter for Notifications
After adding to Sheet1, checks if bounty should trigger notification:
- Created within last 5 days
- Not already sent (not in Sheet2)

## Format Email Template
Converts bounty data into styled HTML email with GitHub-themed design

## Update Workflow Trigger
Runs every 6 hours to update existing bounty statuses

## Update Sheet2 Status
Fetches fresh data from GitHub API for each bounty in Sheet2 to detect changes

## Detect Changes (Sheet2)
Updates only if:
- Issue state changed (open/closed)
- Comment count changed

## Update Sheet1 Status
Checks Sheet1 bounties for state or timestamp changes

## Detect Changes (Sheet1)
Updates only if:
- Issue state changed
- Updated timestamp changed

## WhatsApp Notification (Disabled)
Currently using Gmail instead - enable if needed

# GitHub Bounty Tracker

## Two Workflows:
1. **New Bounties** (hourly): Find & notify about new bounties
2. **Status Updates** (6 hours): Update existing bounty states

## Two Sheets:
- **Sheet1**: All bounties (comprehensive list)
- **Sheet2**: Recent bounties for notifications (5-day window)

My work spans software development, automation, data analysis, and infrastructure tooling, with a strong focus on contributing to and improving the open-source ecosystem.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
